medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset abdominal pain, specifically acute epigastric pain radiating to the chest and back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain had an acute onset around 2 pm after a meal of clam chowder and clams. The patient has never experienced pain like this before. Associated symptoms included diffuse diaphoresis, nausea, and vomiting. Currently, the abdominal pain is improving and the patient feels well, with no nausea, vomiting, or chest pain at present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, obesity, diabetes (type II). Past surgical history includes laparoscopic cholecystectomy and umbilical hernia repair (distant past).
